title: Enhancing Effectiveness of Elementary Social Studies Education Through Collaborative Learning Space Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of elementary education curricula and foundational cooperative learning theories
context.additional_context: Practice-centered course for current elementary teachers to observe learner interactions in collaborative learning environments and analyze behavioral changes based on spatial design

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the impact of various table arrangements (circular, rectangular, U-shaped) on verbal and non-verbal interactions among learners.
Learners can construct experimental designs to compare the efficiency of collaborative learning in 4-person vs. 6-person group sizes.
Learners can observe and document behavioral patterns during problem-solving processes in groups with different gender compositions.
Learners can propose improvement plans that enhance participation in social studies collaborative activities by over 20% through physical learning space redesign.

resources: Modular Mobile Tables in Various Configurations
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
